articles.title: Learn How Modern JS Frameworks Work by Building One
articles.description: Building things is a great way to learn, even if you don‚Äôt end up using what you built. Even better is when someone who‚Äôs already built something successful introduces you to the process. Nolan doesn‚Äôt go super deep but far enough to whet your appetite and for you to learn a few things by taking it further.
articles.author: Nolan Lawson

articles.title: üöÄ ¬†Astro 4.0 Released
articles.description: The new major release of the Astro content-site framework is just out, including a new dev toolbar, automatic i18n routing, new view transition APIs, and more. There‚Äôs also, experimentally, incremental content caching. Upgrading is simple ‚Äì an npx @astrojs/upgrade away for most folks.
articles.author: Astro

articles.title: Maglev: V8‚Äôs Fastest Optimizing JIT
articles.description: An interesting look under the hood of how the V8 JavaScript engine (as used in Chrome, Node.js and elsewhere) continues to get faster thanks to work on its Maglev JIT compiler which sits between the existing Sparkplug and TurboFan compilers (which both have distinct compilation speed vs code performance tradeoffs).
articles.author: The V8 Team

articles.title: Prettier's CLI: A Performance Deep Dive
articles.description: We‚Äôve recently written about the bounty the Prettier project put up (and how Biome won it) but Prettier has also been working on itself by hiring the author of this post to find and implement performance improvements, all while sticking with JavaScript.
articles.author: Fabio Spampinato

articles.title: The Complete Puppeteer Cheatsheet
articles.description: If you want to control a headless Chrome browser from JavaScript, Puppeteer is for you.
articles.author: Mohan Ganesan

articles.title: How Marketing Changed OOP in JavaScript
articles.description: A look at JavaScript‚Äôs earliest history and its prototypal nature.
articles.author: Juan Diego Rodr√≠guez

articles.title: Goodbye, Clean Code
articles.description: Much as Donald Knuth warned us away from premature optimization, here Dan Abramov tells us to beware of premature refactoring and de-duplication. (A golden oldie post from 2020.)
articles.author: Dan Abramov

articles.title: I Replaced npm, yarn and nvm with pnpm
articles.description: npm hasn‚Äôt been the only package manager in town for many years.
articles.author: Pawel Grzybek

articles.title: TSDiagram: Diagrams as Code with TypeScript
articles.description: Draft diagrams quickly with TypeScript. Define data models through top-level type aliases and interfaces and it automatically lays out things out in an efficient way. GitHub repo.
articles.author: Andrei Neculaesei

articles.title: StyleX: Meta's CSS-in-JS Styling System
articles.description: A newly open sourced ‚ÄúCSS-in-JS‚Äù library from Meta made up of a JavaScript syntax and compiler for styling web apps. Jack Herrington has ‚ñ∂Ô∏è a 13-minute screencast taking a practical look.
articles.author: Goel and Gallagher (Meta)

articles.title: tsParticles 3.0: Particles, Confetti and Fireworks for Your Pages
articles.description: Create customizable particle related effects for use on the Web. Uses the regular 2D canvas for broad support.
articles.author: Matteo Bruni

articles.title: Culori: A General-Purpose Color Manipulation Library
articles.description: Supports most color spaces and formats defined in the CSS Colors Level 4 spec and can parse, convert, mix, create color differences, and more. GitHub repo.
articles.author: Moqups

articles.title: Perfume.js 9.2: Web Performance Library for Measuring User-Centric¬†Metrics
articles.description: A tiny web perf monitoring library that reports data back to your favorite analytics tool and supports the latest browser performance APIs for precise metrics on things like first paint, total blocking time, etc.
articles.author: Leonardo Zizzamia

articles.title: Timenames: A Unique Name for Each Second of the Day
articles.description: The author had an app and wanted to create more interesting unique filenames without using the time directly. There‚Äôs a live demo showing the names in action.
articles.author: Ankur Seth

articles.title: YouTube.js 8.0: A Wrapper Around YouTube's Private 'InnerTube' API
articles.description: It uses the same behind the scenes API as official YouTube clients, rather than the official developer API, so, as always, your mileage may vary.
articles.author: LuanRT

articles.description: üìä The WebAssembly vs JavaScript (PDF) paper compares the energy requirements and performance of JS and WASM on the Web. Spoiler: "WebAssembly is faster than JavaScript and even more energy efficient."
A recap of the Electron ecosystem in 2023.
The New Stack weighs up the pros and cons of using React today.
Talk about going down a rabbit hole, but did you know it's possible to use Nuxt, Vue and Tailwind CSS to build an Adobe Premier Pro plugin?
Popular ingress service ngrok has unveiled a JavaScript SDK to add secure ingress to Node apps.
The Construct 3 2D game engine now supports TypeScript.
Electron 28 ‚Äì Now with ESM support, Chromium 120 & Node.js 18.18.2.
Fresh 1.6 ‚Äì The Deno-based web framework.
React Native 0.73 ‚Äì Now with full Android 14 support, Kotlin becomes the recommended language for Android, and more.
HTML5 Boilerplate v9.0 ‚Äì Blast from the past!
Redux 5.0, Redux Toolkit 2.0, and more.
Node.js v21.4.0 (Current), Qwik 1.3, and Redwood 6.5

articles.title: Taking Care Beyond Code: 7 Best Design Practices for Frontend Developers
articles.description: When a frontend engineer fails to think about the importance of design, the user experience can suffer. This post highlights the importance of a holistic approach, offering pointers and best practices to ultimately result in less bugs and overall delays.
articles.author: Nina Torgunakova

articles.title: üöÄ ¬†Astro 4.0 Released
articles.description: The new major release of the Astro content-site framework is just out, including a new dev toolbar, automatic i18n routing, new view transition APIs, and more. There‚Äôs also, experimentally, incremental content caching. Upgrading is simple ‚Äì an npx @astrojs/upgrade away for most folks.
articles.author: Astro

articles.title: An Informed Pre-Caching Strategy for Large Sites
articles.description: Pre-caching, also called cache priming or cache warming, involves preemptively putting items into the cache before they are requested by a user. Ethan shares how this can be a great way to reduce expensive computations and strain on the origin server, but notes that once a site gets to a certain scale, it requires more thought than simply keeping everything in a warmed cache.
articles.author: Ethan Gardner

articles.title: Why Web Perf Tools Should Be Reporting Website Carbon¬†Emissions
articles.description: A response to a DebugBear post explaining why the company opts not to report carbon emissions in their reports. Fershad gently suggests why they should, chiefly to allow developers the opportunity to contextualize the impact of their sites.
articles.author: Fershad Irani

articles.title: sizes="auto" Pretty Much Requires Width and Height¬†Attributes
articles.description: Eric notes that ‚Äòauto-sizes‚Äô for lazy-loaded images is a fantastic addition to the web platform, but they curiously do basically require a width and height attribute.
articles.author: Eric Portis

articles.title: Does Interaction to Next Paint Actually Correlate to User¬†Behavior?
articles.description: Now that Interaction to Next Paint is poised to dethrone FID as the Core Web Vitals metric for responsiveness, it‚Äôs time to scrutinize its effectiveness.
articles.author: Cliff Crocker

articles.title: Examples of Great URL Design
articles.description: Some examples of good URLs and why following certain patterns might be helpful. ‚ÄúThey‚Äôre not just for typing into browser bars.‚Äù
articles.author: Jim Nielsen

articles.title: ClassyFont: An Online Tool to Generate CSS for Your Fonts
articles.description: Upload your web-friendly fonts and this tool will generate the necessary @font-face code. You can edit the URL paths, the font fallbacks, and the naming style (camel case, hyphen, underscore).
articles.author: sakar hamasaid

articles.title: Pravatar: Avatar Placeholder Photos Under a CC0 License
articles.description: Provides an API so you can access a random image, specifying the size, or choose a specific image from all those available by image ID, all sourced from Pexels.
articles.author: simular

articles.title: Design2Code: Use AI to Convert Any Web Design Screenshot to Clean HTML/CSS Code
articles.description: Claims to support sketches, wireframes, Figma, XD, etc. Requires an OpenAI API key and the demo video shows an HTML form being converted from an image to responsive HTML/CSS. YMMV for other types of layouts!
articles.author: Mostafa Sadeghi
